back_cards.example_en: We decided to stay at the hotel overnight.

back_cards.definition_en: To continue in a certain state
back_cards.example_en: She stayed calm during the crisis.
He’s staying with friends while in town.
Let’s stay here until the rain stops.
Their friendship stayed strong over the years.
Add sugar to the recipe for sweetness.
She added hours to her work schedule.
He added a comment to the discussion.
The teacher asked us to add the numbers.
They added a new member to the team.
Let’s meet later this afternoon.
She called me later that evening.
We’ll deal with that issue later.
Later models of the car were more efficient.

back_cards.definition_en: In comparison to an earlier time
back_cards.example_en: Things got better later in the day.
She changed her hairstyle for the event.

back_cards.definition_en: To replace one thing with another
back_cards.example_en: He changed his shirt after spilling coffee.
The weather changed suddenly this morning.
Can you change a twenty for me?
They changed their vacation destination.
She bought five apples at the store.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of five items or people
back_cards.example_en: The team consists of five players.
The meeting starts at five.
The room is five meters wide.
I gave the movie five stars.

back_cards.definition_en: Likely to happen or be true
back_cards.example_en: It will probably rain this afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: With a high degree of certainty
back_cards.example_en: She’s probably the best candidate for the job.
He’s probably at home by now.
They probably forgot about the meeting.
This is probably the last bus of the day.
The statue is in the center of the park.
The community center hosts yoga classes.
The city is the cultural center of the region.
He plays center on the basketball team.
Education is at the center of her campaign.

back_cards.definition_en: Surrounded by or in the company of
back_cards.example_en: She felt safe among her friends.
He was among the top performers.

back_cards.definition_en: Shared by members of a group
back_cards.example_en: The prize was divided among the winners.

back_cards.definition_en: In the context of a category
back_cards.example_en: This book is among the best in its genre.
Tensions rose among the team members.

back_cards.definition_en: The front part of a person’s head
back_cards.example_en: She smiled, her face lighting up.
The face of the clock was cracked.
He had a serious face during the meeting.
The company worked to save face after the scandal.

back_cards.definition_en: A side or aspect of something
back_cards.example_en: The face of the mountain was steep.
The park is open to public use.
Public transportation is affordable.
She works in public service.
His speech was a public statement.
The library is a public resource.
The plant died from lack of water.
The old car finally died on the highway.
The tradition died out over time.
I’m dying to see the new movie.
He was dying of embarrassment after the speech.
She cooked healthy food for dinner.
Italian food is my favorite.
The charity provided food to the homeless.
The party had plenty of food.
Food for thought came from the lecture.
What else do you need from the store?
Let’s try somewhere else for lunch.
Hurry, or else we’ll miss the bus.
Who else was at the meeting?
Nothing else matters right now.
She loves reading about ancient history.
His medical history shows no allergies.
The book tells the history of the town.
Their history together spans decades.
He majored in history at college.
She bought a new phone yesterday.
His charm bought him many friends.
I don’t buy his excuse for being late.
They bought tickets for the concert.
He bought the car at an auction.
The result of the experiment was surprising.
His decision had serious results.
The test results came in today.
The result of the meeting was a new plan.
The survey results showed clear trends.
I drink coffee every morning.
She goes jogging in the morning.
The morning brought fresh opportunities.

back_cards.definition_en: A greeting for the time of day
back_cards.example_en: He said ‘good morning’ with a smile.

back_cards.definition_en: The early part of an event
back_cards.example_en: The morning session was productive.
She ran off to catch the bus.
Please turn the lights off.
The island is off the coast.
The meeting is off due to rain.
His performance was a bit off today.
Her parents attended the school play.
The foster parent cared for the child.
The company is a parent to several brands.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a nurturing role
back_cards.example_en: Parents cheered at the soccer game.
His parents passed down family traditions.
She works in a downtown office.
He ran for public office last year.
The office is closed on weekends.
The tax office sent a notice.
The office has a friendly atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of lessons or studies
back_cards.example_en: She enrolled in a coding course.
The river follows a winding course.
The main course was delicious.
The best course of  action is to wait.
The golf course was well-maintained.

back_cards.definition_en: To dispatch something to a destination
back_cards.example_en: She sent a letter to her friend.
He sent an email to the team.
They sent their kids to summer camp.
Send my regards to your family.
The rocket sent the satellite into orbit.
Her research focuses on climate change.
The university funds medical research.
He did research before buying a car.
Research into AI is advancing rapidly.
The report is based on extensive research.

back_cards.definition_en: To move on foot at a regular pace
back_cards.example_en: She walks to school every day.
Let’s walk to the nearby café.
They walked along the beach at sunset.
He walked her home after the party.
She walked through the steps of the recipe.
Please close the door behind you.

back_cards.definition_en: An entrance to a building or room
back_cards.example_en: She knocked on the front door.
Education opened the door to new opportunities.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of furniture or a vehicle
back_cards.example_en: The car door was stuck.
His skills opened doors in his career.
She wore a white dress to the party.
His face turned white from fear.
The survey included White participants.
The white tablecloth looked spotless.
I prefer white wine with dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: More than two but not many
back_cards.example_en: She visited several stores to find a dress.
Several books were left on the table.
He called several times this morning.
They discussed several different topics.
Several students joined the club.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where legal cases are heard
back_cards.example_en: The case was settled in court.
They played basketball on the court.
The king held a banquet at court.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of advisors or officials
back_cards.example_en: The queen consulted her court.
The lawyer presented evidence in court.
She went home after work.
Their home is always welcoming.
He considers Italy his home.
The runner slid into home plate.
This café feels like home.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: The plant grew quickly in the sunlight.
She’s growing into a confident leader.
They grow vegetables in their garden.
The business grew over the years.
He grew tired after the long day.
This is a better option than the last one.
She found a better way to solve the problem.
He’s feeling better after the flu.
Our team did better than expected.
The weather is better today.
She opened the window for fresh air.
They opened the meeting with a speech.
He opened up about his feelings.
The flower opened in the morning sun.

back_cards.definition_en: To launch a business or event
back_cards.example_en: The store opened its doors last week.

back_cards.definition_en: A very brief period of time
back_cards.example_en: Wait a moment while I grab my keys.
That was a defining moment in her career.
At that moment, the phone rang.
This is not the moment to argue.
She seized the moment to speak up.

back_cards.definition_en: Containing as part of a whole
back_cards.example_en: The team, including me, attended the event.
The menu includes dishes, including dessert.
The package, including taxes, costs $100.
Everyone, including the kids, helped clean.
The cast, including new actors, was stellar.
She considered all options before deciding.
He’s considered an expert in his field.
Please consider my feelings in this matter.
They considered the risks of the project.
I need time to consider your offer.
Both books are on the shelf.
Both teams played well in the match.
She likes both coffee and tea.
Both parents attended the meeting.
They both decided to stay home.
Such behavior is unacceptable here.
It was such a beautiful day.
Such issues need immediate attention.
Plants such as roses need care.
I’ve never seen such a big dog.
She has a little puppy.
My little brother is five years old.
There’s little time left to finish.
It’s just a little mistake, don’t worry.
I’m a little tired after the hike.
The keys are within the drawer.
Finish the task within an hour.
The cost is within our budget.
She works within the marketing team.
The shop is within walking distance.
The race was won by a second.
She came in second in the competition.
Wait a second, I’ll be right back.
He acted as her second in the duel.
Would you like a second piece of cake?
